rooms.Name: The drawbridge
rooms.Description:
You are standing on an old wooden drawbridge. Below you is the castle moat,
and you see a couple of fearsome-looking moat monsters lurking down below.
You do a double-take as you realize that one of them has a bright red bow tied
around its head. You smile and lean closer, and the beast almost snaps your
head off! Must be magic involved, you surmise. You can go into the castle to
the west, or back along the magic path to the east.

rooms.Name: Northwestern Corner of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
This is the northwestern corner of the Great Hall of mighty Castle Roogna.
A number of shining gems, jewelry, and objets d'art are stored behind a
glass case here. The amount of dust on the glass seems to display that gold
and gems are not particularly prized here in Xanth, and you wonder again at
the strangeness of this land and its people. The Hall extends to the south
and to the east.

rooms.Name: North End of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
You are at the north end of the Great Hall. The Great Hall continues to the
south, east, and west, and to the north you see a long hallway with doors
on the east and west sides. At the end of the hallway seems to be a small
staircase leading down, but it is hard to tell from this distance.

rooms.Name: Northeastern Corner of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
You are in the northeastern corner of Castle Roogna's Great Hall. A number of
beautiful paintings and tapestries are hung from the wall here. You notice
one in particular of a huge barbarian riding the back of a centaur and waving
a thin hoop made of gold at a swarm of harpies. It is entitled "The Building
of Castle Roogna", strangely enough. The Hall extends to the south and west.

rooms.Name: West End of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
You are at the western end of Castle Roogna's Great Hall. Before you is a
smallish throne, sheathed in gold, but not to the point of gaudiness. Xanth
is a simple kingdom, and feels no need to drape its rulers in garish finery.
Occupying the seat of power is a fairly handsome young man who does not look
entirely comfortable with his situation, for he sits there frowning and lost
in thought. Perhaps you should await His Majesty's pleasure instead of making
a nuisance of yourself. The Hall extends to the north, south, and east, and
to the west lies a narrow hallway that passes two doors and ends at a small
stone staircase leading up to another part of the castle.

rooms.Name: The Center of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
You are in the center of the castle's Great Hall. It is plushly carpeted, but
rather bare. Evidently there are only a few people living at the castle, so
the center of the hall is only used for dining when a lot of visitors show up.
This gives you a strangely homey feeling, and you look upon the place in a
new light. The Great Hall extends in all four cardinal directions.

rooms.Name: East End of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
You are in the Great Hall of mighty Castle Roogna. The castle was named for
the king who ordered it constructed, many many years ago. It has survived
invasions, curses, dragon attacks, and wiggles, and it can certainly survive
you. The Great Hall extends to the north, east, and west, the drawbridge lies
to the south. You see a simple golden throne at the western end of the hall.

rooms.Name: Southwest Corner of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
You are in the southwestern corner of Castle Roogna's Great Hall. There are
a few books on a shelving unit over here, and a dumbwaiter leading up to the
top floor of the castle. A comfortable chair sits near the shelves, and a
glowing ball is suspended from a chain hanging over the chair. You scan a
few of the titles, but nothing looks particularly interesting. The Hall
extends to the north and east from here.

rooms.Name: South End of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
You are at the southern end of the Great Hall of Castle Roogna. A set of
beautiful mahogany shelves holds a number of crystalline figurines, each of
which is priceless. You step cautiously around them to avoid breakage. The
Hall continues to the north, east, and west, and a long hallway leads south
from here, with door on the east and west walls. It appears as though there
is a stairwell leading down at the end of the hallways, but you are too far
away to tell for sure.

rooms.Name: Southeastern Corner of the Great Hall
rooms.Description:
You are in the southeastern corner of mighty Castle Roogna's splendid great
hall. A large number of beautifully crafted statues are here. You see one
of midnight black, depicting a beautiful mare, entitled "Mare Imbrium, once
King of Xanth". What? These people once had a horse as ruling monarch? On
the side opposite this statue is a silver one of the same size, which looks
strangely familiar...it is the Gap Dragon! At the bottom of the statue is
the legend "HERO DRAGON". Well, that dragon didn't seem heroic to you...

rooms.Name: The southern wing
rooms.Description:
You are in a narrow hallway at the southern end of Castle Roogna. To the east
and west are the doors to some guest chambers, the Great Hall lies to the
north, and the hallway continues to the south. At the southern end of the
hallway you spy a staircase leading down.

Exits.Description: A wooden door sheathed in gold leads into the chamber.

rooms.Name: The southern wing
rooms.Description:
You are walking down a narrow hallway in the southern portion of Castle Roogna.
The hallway continues north and south and ends in a small stone staircase
leading down, further to the south.  There are some guest chambers here
for visiting VIP's and their families.

rooms.Name: The southern wing
rooms.Description:
Continuing down this narrow hallway in the southern part of Castle Roogna, you
stop for a moment to consider your options. Two large, heavy wooden doors on
the east and west sides of the hallway bar passage into a couple of guest
chambers, for use by friends and relations of the Royal Family, the hallway
continues to the north, and to the south, you see a small stone staircase that
leads down into another part of the castle.

Exits.Description: A large, heavy door leads into the chamber.
A large, heavy wooden door leads into the chamber.

rooms.Name: The staircase to the cellars
rooms.Description:
You are standing at a small cul-de-sac in the southern portion of the castle.
To the north lies a long hallway lined with doors on the east and west sides,
or you may descend the small stone staircase and enter the cellars.

rooms.Name: The northern wing
rooms.Description:
You are in a small hallway in the northern part of Castle Roogna. The floor is
made of heavy stone, but a thick, soft carpet absorbs the shock of your
footsteps. The hallway continues north, to the south lies the Great Hall, and
heavy doors made of oak lie to the east and west. At the end of the hallway,
you see a small staircase leading down.

Exits.Description: A heavy oaken door leads into a chamber here.

rooms.Name: The northern wing
rooms.Description:
You are walking down a narrow hallway in the northern part of Castle Roogna.
To the east and west, stout oaken doors stand before the entrances to some
of the castle's guest chambers, and the hall continues north and south. At
the northern end of the hall you see a staircase going down.

Exits.Description: A sturdy oaken door leads into the chamber.

rooms.Name: The northern wing
rooms.Description:
You are walking down a hallway in the northern part of Castle Roogna. Directly
to the north of you is a small staircase, leading down to another part of the
castle, and to the east and west lie heavy oaken doors, leading into some
guest chambers. To the south, the hallway continues.

Exits.Description: A stout wooden door leads into the chamber.

rooms.Name: The staircase to the cellars
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a small cul-de-sac in the northern wing of Castle Roogna.
The hallway extends back to the south, or you can descend the small stone
staircase that leads into the dark and creepy cellars of the ancient castle.

rooms.Name: The western hallway
rooms.Description:
You are in a small hallway leading west, just west of the Great Hall, right
behind the throne in fact. A pair of thin wooden doors lie on the north
and south sides of the hallway, and you detect the bustling sounds and the
mouth-watering smells of the castle kitchens to the south. The northern door
is quiet, but does not seem to be locked if you care to look around. To the
west lies a large wooden staircase that leads up to the top floor of the
castle, where you might find the rest of the Royal Family.

Exits.Description: A thin wooden door takes you into the room.
A thin wooden door leads you into the kitchens.

rooms.Name: The staircase to the second floor
rooms.Description:
You are standing before a large staircase made of rich, dark wood. It leads
up to the second floor of the castle. To the east, you see a hallway that
leads past the castle kitchens into the Great Hall of Castle Roogna.

rooms.Name: Humfrey and the Gorgon's chamber
rooms.Description:
This chamber is used by Good Magician Humfrey and his stunning wife, the
Gorgon, when they need a break from their hectic life at their own castle.
This room appears to be waging a constant war between chaos and order, with
an uneasy truce keeping the peace. Several pairs of socks are scattered across
the bed, not yet sorted to Humfrey's satisfaction, and a bunch of vials sit
haphazardly on the small table in the center of the room, having yet to be
examined and classified. However, there are some pretty curtains on the clean
glass windows, and the whole room is remarkably free of dust. It looks like
Humfrey has a good woman in the Gorgon; let's hope he appreciates it!

Exits.Description: A stout wooden door leads out of the chamber.

rooms.Name: The second challenge
rooms.Description:
Ok, you've made it past the first challenge, now what?  Somehow you
have to get by this HUGE ogre.  Perhaps fighting him isn't the best
idea.  Besides, brains always overcomes brawn, doesn't it?  This roo,
is a large cage, no doubt to keep the ogre from wrecking the rest of
the castle and generally wreaking havoc.  There is a huge pile of food
in one corner and you can see a small (compared to to the ogre) trapdoor
in the cage where the tray is slid through.
The floor is solid stone, and the bars look think enough that the ogre
can't bend them... of course this means you'll have no chance to bend them
either.  Maybe there is another way...

rooms.Name: Jordan and Threnody's chamber
rooms.Description:
This room is used by Jordan the barbarian and his main squeeze Threnody, the
half-demon songstress once cursed to remain outside the castle or see it fall
to pieces. King Dor eventually located a counterspell, and now the happy 
couple are free to stay in the castle whenever their adventures bring them by.
This room is furnished with a large, comfortable double bed, a small table
with a large bowl of fresh fruit on it, a sturdy weapons rack with various
polished devices of doom on it, and some pretty curtains on the window. Looks
like these two are very skilled at reaching a compromise.

rooms.Name: Grundy and Rapunzel's chamber
rooms.Description:
This chamber belongs to Grundy the Golem and his wife Rapunzel. The furniture
here is very small, and bespeaks a woman's touch. On one side is a vanity
with a lot of fine-toothed combs neatly arranged on it, and on the other is
a small bed, obviously designed for two people despite being no bigger than
a pillow. There is a chair of normal size over by the door, with a set of
knitting needles and some yarn by it. Wonder who uses it?

Exits.Description: A sturdy oaken door leads out of the chamber.

rooms.Name: Into the Night
rooms.Description:
You are floating among the stars, above the atmosphere, Earth layed
out beneath you in a beautiful panorama.  You can see forever in all
directions, except below you where the browns and blues and greens
of the earth fill your vision.  It is perfectly quiet and serene up
here, for no sound may pass through this vacuum.  The moon shines
brightly off to one side, it's soft light bathing your body in a wan
yellow glow.  This is where MidKnight goes to be alone, or just to
rest and think, for nothing is quite so serene or peaceful as his
night sky.

rooms.Name: Chester Centaur's chamber
rooms.Description:
This is the chamber used by Chester Centaur when he is visiting the castle
overnight, away from his lovely filly Cherie in Centaur Village. It is very
sparsely furnished, for otherwise there wouldn't be enough room for both
Chester and the furniture. You see a hammock tied up next to the wall, and
a few coils of rope, quivers of arrows, and a sharp sword sit ready to be
used in a small rack near the window. Chester is getting old, but he has
obviously not lost his taste for adventure.

Exits.Description: A heavy oaken door leads back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: The third and final challenge
rooms.Description: Two down, one to go.  Third time's a charm, right?  Onward and upward.

rooms.Name: Iris and Trent's chamber
rooms.Description:
This chamber is perhaps a bit more lavish than the others, being reserved for
King Emeritus Trent and Queen Emeritus Iris, the former rulers of the Land of
Xanth. A big four-poster sits in the center of the room, and lovely tapestries
cover the walls. In the corner is a small desk with writing materials on it,
and a huge closet on the other side of the room holds many magnificent clothes.
You are almost awestruck by the splendor here, but then you recall that Iris's
talent is said to be illusion, so can you really trust what you see?

Exits.Description: A wooden door sheathed in gold leads out of the chamber.

rooms.Name: Xavier and Zora's chamber
rooms.Description:
This chamber is used by Xavier and Zora, two friends of Dor and Irene's who
live in central Xanth and occassionally stop by to say hi. You notice that
most of the furniture here follows a yellow motif, yellow being Xavier's
favorite color. You see a dartboard on the wall, imported from Mundania, that
has a number of scorch marks on it, mostly clustered around the center. The
room seems fairly quiet and ordinary, all things considered.

rooms.Name: Murphy and Vadne's chamber
rooms.Description:
Murphy, a former contender for kingship of Xanth, resides here with his wife,
the Sorceress Vadne. Murphy, a powerful Magician who was exiled into Mundania
for abusing his talent of making things go wrong, appears to have repented his
acts and now leads a quiet life in Castle Roogna, waiting for the day when his
talent may be needed again. Vadne, exiled for a similar reason, has similarly
"gone straight", and their son Grey is in fact engaged to Princess Ivy. This
room is a bit more Mundane than the others, perhaps because of the occupants'
long imprisonment there.

rooms.Name: Chem Centaur's chamber
rooms.Description:
This chamber has a well-worn floor, as if a very heavy person uses it. You
notice that this chamber is pretty sparsely furnished, and that all of the
tables are much higher off the ground than a human would want to use. This
looks like a centaur's chamber, come to think of it. Several drafting tables
with mapping gear stand ready at strategic places about the room. This must
be Chem Centaur's chamber, since Chem is the Official Royal Mapmaker for the
Land of Xanth. She spends a lot fo time at Castle Roogna, both because of her
job and because centaurs with magic talents are shunned by their people. Chem
is a nice young lady for all of that, though.

Exits.Description: A large, heavy wooden door leads out of the chamber.

rooms.Name: Chet Centaur's chamber
rooms.Description:
This chamber is where Chet Centaur, one of King Dor's closest friends, stays
when he is around Castle Roogna. Chet is a very intelligent guy, with a gift
for mathematics, and he also has a magic talent like his sister Chem, which
is turning boulders into pebbles. He calls this calculus, and uses it to
help him calculate, but not many people understand what he means by that. He
is also a very resourceful individual, and a good asset to the kingdom. His
room is furnished in a Spartan fashion, but is comfortable enough.

Exits.Description: A large, heavy door leads out of the chamber.

rooms.Name: The castle dining area
rooms.Description:
You are in the northwest corner of the dining area, right where the L-shaped
table bends. The center position appears to have been reserved for King Dor,
for the place setting there is gold instead of silver. But at least he is
friendly enough to eat at the same table as the rest of the castle, unlike
other kings you have heard of. The dining area extends to the south and east
from here, but it looks like more of the same.

rooms.Name: The castle dining area
rooms.Description:
You are standing in front of the northern portion of the L-shaped table. It
seems to be made of ironwood, for it gives off a dull metallica noise as you
tap it with your fingernail. A number of places are already set here, and the
plates look to be made of fine porcelain, while the tablware appears to be
real sterling silver. This looks like a very relaxing place to have a meal.
The dining area extends to the south and west.

rooms.Name: The castle dining area
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the western portion of the L-shaped table, admiring the
intricate carvings on the sides. It's amazing that anyone was able to carve
the table, for usually it takes the strength of an ogre to even scratch it,
but in Xanth, anything is possible, with magic. At any rate, the carvings
are nice, and you feel you have about exhausted the amusement value of the
castle dining area. It extends to the north and east from here.

rooms.Name: The castle dining area
rooms.Description:
This is where the residents of Castle Roogna usually take their meals, unless
there is an important function or a lot of guests, in which case the Great
Hall is used. A very large L-shaped table covers the whole northwest corner
of this room, and fifteen or twenty places have been set. A few knick-knacks
are littered about the place, probably to aid digestion. The dining area
extends to the north and west from here.

Exits.Description: A thin wooden door takes you back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: The castle kitchens
rooms.Description:
Ummmmm, this place is really making your stomach growl. A busy group of cooks
are making pastry over here. They look like buns, but you notice that the
cooks keep burning their fingers on them and speaking sharply to each other.
These must be the famous hot cross puns you have heard about. The kitchens
extend to the south and east.

rooms.Name: The castle kitchens
rooms.Description:
You have entered the kitchens of Castle Roogna, and boy does it smell good in
here! All around you, talented cooks are using magic and good old elbow grease
to prepare delightful concoctions guaranteed to make your mouth water. The 
cooks seem a little preoccupied right now, so maybe you can grab yourself a
taste without anybody noticing. The kitchens extend to the south and west, or
you can go back into the hallway through the door to the north.

Exits.Description: A thin wooden door takes you back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: The castle kitchens
rooms.Description:
A few sinks are over here, and several young lads are washing dishes. Some of
them appear to be using the soap and water method, but a few brave souls are
using some magic cleaning powder, which is forever running out. There are few
things more humiliating than running around the castle chasing running powder.
They appear engrossed in their task and pay you no mind. The kitchens extend
to the north and east from here.

rooms.Name: The castle kitchens
rooms.Description:
You are over by the big firepit, and it is pretty darned hot over here. It
looks like the cooks here are preparing tonight's main course, dragon steak
with hot sauce. It isn't often available, because far more men are eaten by
dragons than dragons eaten by men, but it is a dish well worth waiting for.
The kitchens extend to the north and west from here.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You have descended the staircase, and entered the dark and musty cellars of
Castle Roogna. These look to have been abandoned for years, at least by
humans. But since so much of Xanth is illusion, there really is no way to
be sure what is down here. The cellars continue to the north, or you can go
back up the staircase and into the castle proper.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
Pushing aside some thick and sticky cobwebs, you continue your exploration of
the cellars. There doesn't appear to be too much of interest in this portion,
but you hear some odd noises from the north that lead you to believe you are
not alone down here. You can continue north or south through the cellars.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are in the dark and dirty cellars below Castle Roogna. They continue north
and south from here, and there is a small alcove to the east, but it is too
dark to tell what might lie there. You'll have to check it out, if you want
to know. Hopefully it isn't anything dangerous.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are in a small offshoot of the cellars. It appears that some kegs of beer
have been left here, but the foul smell of rotting wood informs you that there
is nothing of value left. In fact, it'd be a good idea to get out of here
before you get sick. The cellars continue to the west.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
Yuck! This part of the cellar looks like a breeding ground for diseases. A
bunch of big rats scurry around a pile of rotting meat, nearly two weeks old
by the smell of it. You hear a muffled crowing, and you realize that a nest
of cockroaches must be nearby. You feel sick to your stomach, and decide
that a hasty retreat is definitely in order. The cellars extend to the north
and east from here.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
The dust is really stirred up over here. It looks like something roams around
this area a lot, something about man-sized from the shape of the tracks. The
trail is kind of indistinct, so you are not positive what made the tracks,
but you are convinced that you are definitely not alone down here...the
cellars extend to the south and east.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
The cellars widen out quite a bit here, and you notice that the dust on the
floor has been stirred by something. Examining more closely, you determine
that it looks like the floor of the cellar has been scraped by bones. You
feel a sudden chill...is this how the King disposes of his enemies? He
seemed like such a nice guy! Then you hear the sound of bone clicking on the
floor from somewhere in the darkness, and you break into a sweat as your hand 
grips the handle of your weapon tightly. The cellars continue to the north,
south, and west.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are walking through the dark, dingy cellars of Castle Roogna when suddenly
your light source reflects off of something blindingly white. It's a human
skeleton, and it's headed straight for you! You choke back a scream and ready
your weapon, but it does not appear interested in tearing you to shreds. It
speaks (?) in a cultured, stoic voice: "My name is Marrow Bones. Can I help
you with something?" You feel heartily confused. The cellars extend to the
south, west and east.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are in the cramped and dusty cellars of mighty Castle Roogna. As you step
on the floor, something goes *crunch* under your foot, and an absolutely
sickening smell wafts up to your nose. As you mop the tears away from your
eyes and desperately pray to lose your sense of smell, you realize that you
must have stepped on a stink bug. Yuck! The cellars extend north and west
from where you are now.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
The cellars appear to be getting damper here. You must be right above the
water table. In fact, there's a small pool right in front of you, with a
small leather shoe sitting right in the middle. Must be a water moccassin.
The cellars extend north and south from here.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are just before another area where the cellar widens out. You seem to hear
some clicking noises from the north, but the acoustics down here are pretty
strange. At any rate, the cellars extend north and south from here.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
Not only have the cellars gotten wider here, they also appear darker than
before. Also colder. The whole effect is giving you the chills, and you
begin to yearn for the open countryside again. And then there are those
nasty clicking noises, from up ahead...the cellars continue north, south,
and west from here.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
Trying to keep your feet out of the rat droppings, you almost step on what
your light source reveals as a shapely female human skeleton. You let out
an involuntary yelp of fear and jump back, but the skeleton does not seem
interested in ripping you apart. Instead, she says in a sweet voice (?):
"Hi, I'm Grace'l Ossein. Have you seen my husband Marrow?" You shake your
head in wonder. What a weird place! The cellar continues south and west.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
As you enter this portion of the cellars, a whining little voice down at your
feet starts piping something about the Middle East Crisis, the Generation X
Crisis, the arms race, the environmental situation, and on and on. You yawn,
and look down. A small reddish-brown beetle is speaking in a very serious
voice about all the troubles of the world today. You yawn again, and push
it over with your foot. It must be a boring beetle. The cellars extend north
and east from here.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are walking along in the spooky cellars of the castle, when suddenly a
nameless feeling of dread fills you. You are just about to wet your pants in
fright, when you decide to name the dread "Irving". Suddenly, the fear
subsides, for that is the only way to deal with a Nameless Dread. Who could
be scared of something called "Irving"? The cellars continue to the north,
south, and east from where you are now.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are walking around in the dingy, dusty cellars of Castle Roogna. To the
south, the cellar gets much wider, but it also continues to the west from
here. You seem to hear a clicking noise coming from the south.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are walking through the cellars of Castle Roogna, where it appears no
humans have been for quite a long time. The dust is thick, nearly choking,
here, and cobwebs are everywhere. The cellars continue to the east, and to
the north you see a small stone stairwell leading up.

rooms.Name: The cellars of Castle Roogna
rooms.Description:
You are standing in front of a small stone stairwell that leads back up into
the castle proper. The cellars of the castle continue to the south, and you
get the distinct feeling that you are not alone down here...

rooms.Name: Inside the Good Magician's Castle
rooms.Description:
Congratulations! You have successfully defeated the three challenges required
to gain entrance to the Good Magician's Castle. Now all you have to do is
find him, and ask him your Question. And looking around this castle, that
might be pretty hard to do. Directly to the south of you is an intersection
between two wide hallways, one leading north and south, and the other leading
east and west. The whole castle has a cluttered look to it, though the walls
and floors are spotlessly clean.

rooms.Name: The northwest corner
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the northwest corner of the Good Magician's Castle. To the
north is a wooden door, identical to the others you have seen, and the hallway
proceeds east and south from here.

rooms.Name: The northwestern hallway
rooms.Description:
You are walking through a wide, clean hallway in the Good Magician's castle.
The hallway continues east and west, and to the north and south you see two
spotlessly clean and unmarked wooden doors.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.
A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: The northwestern hallway
rooms.Description:
You are walking around a wide, clean hallway leading east and west that
nevertheless gives the impression of being cluttered. The hallway continues
west, to the east is an intersection, and unmarked wooden doors lie to the
north and south from here.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.
A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: An intersection
rooms.Description:
You are at an intersection between two wide hallways in the Good Magician's
castle. To the east and west, the hallway is lined with doors on both the
north and south sides, all identical, spotlessly clean, and unmarked. To the
north, you see the entrance to the castle and the sunny fields of Xanth
beyond, and to the south, the hallway continues, leading past two doors on
both the east and west sides, until finally reaching a stone staircase going
up, at the end of the hallway.

rooms.Name: The northeastern hallway
rooms.Description:
You are walking through a wide, clean hallway in the northeastern portion of
Good Magician Humfrey's castle. The hallway continues east, an intersection
lies to the west, and to the north and south are two unmarked wooden doors,
identical to all the others you have seen in the castle.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.
A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: The northeastern hallway
rooms.Description:
You are in the northeastern hallway of the Good Magician's castle. The hall
extends to the east and west, and to the north and south stand two identical
wooden doors. The monotony of the place is beginning to get to you.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.
A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: The northeast corner
rooms.Description:
You have reached the northeast corner of the castle. Hallways run to the west
and south, and to the north you see a wooden door exactly the same as all the
others in the castle. Whoever designed this place sure didn't have much time,
or much imagination...

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.

rooms.Name: The western hallway
rooms.Description:
You are walking down a hallway in the western portion of Good Magician
Humfrey's Castle. The hallway is wide and spotlessly clean, and leads north
and south. To the east, you see a stout-looking wooden door.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads east from here.

rooms.Name: The central hallway
rooms.Description:
You are traversing the central hallway through the Good Magician's castle.
Even though the walls and floor are spotlessly clean, the place still manages
to give off an ambience of cluttered-ness. Wise old magicians tend to pick
up a lot of mystical trash, you assume. The hallway continues south, to the
north you see an intersection, and there are identical, unmarked wooden doors
to the east and west of you.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads east from here.
A wooden door leads west from here.

rooms.Name: The eastern hallway
rooms.Description:
You are in the eastern hallway of the castle, which runs north and south from
here. To the west, you see another of the now-familiar wooden doors.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads west from here.

rooms.Name: The western hallway
rooms.Description:
You are in a wide, clean hallway in the western portion of the castle. The
hallway continues north and south, and to the east lies a stout wooden door,
that is completely unmarked and looks identical to all the others you have
seen in the castle so far. Apparently Humfrey is an efficient man.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads east from here.

rooms.Name: The central hallway
rooms.Description:
You are walking down a hallway leading north and south, through the center of
Good Magician Humfrey's castle. The hallway continues north and south, and at
the northern end you see the drawbridge to the castle, while at the southern
end you see a flight of stone stairs leading up to the second floor. There
are also two unmarked wooden doors to the east and west of you.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads east from here.
A wooden door leads west from here.

rooms.Name: The eastern hallway
rooms.Description:
Continuing through the eastern hallway, you see that it leads north and south
from here, and that another of those tiresome wooden doors lies to the west.
You are getting pretty bored with this whole endeavor.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads west from here.

rooms.Name: The southwest corner
rooms.Description:
You are in the southwest corner of Good Magician Humfrey's Castle, where the
western and southern hallways meet. You can proceed north or east from here,
or you can investigate a sturdy wooden door to the south.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: The southwestern hallway
rooms.Description:
You are in a hallway in the southern portion of the castle. It is, of course,
completely spotless. Either this castle is very new, or the cleaning staff is
very efficient. The hallway proceeds east and west, and there are doors to
the north and south from your present location.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.
A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: The southwestern hallway
rooms.Description:
This portion of the hallway looks identical to all the others you have
encountered so far. It is as if this whole castle was made from prefabricated
pieces, or something. The Good Magician must be a man of great knowledge and
formidable resources! The hallway continues to the west, to the east lies an
intersection, and there are unmarked wooden doors to the north and south.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.
A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: An intersection
rooms.Description:
You are at an intersection between the north-south and east-west hallways of
Good Magician Humfrey's Castle. To the north, a wide, clean hallway leads to
the drawbridge and the sunny plains of Xanth beyond, to the east and west, a
similar hallway leads through the castle, and to the south you see a stone
staircase leading up to the second floor of the castle.

rooms.Name: The southeastern hallway
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a hallway in the southeastern part of Good Magician
Humfrey's castle. To the east, the hallway continues, an intersection lies
to the west, and to the north and south you see two more unmarked wooden
doors, identical to all the others in the castle.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.
A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: The southeastern hallway
rooms.Description:
You are walking down another wide, clean hallway, in the southeastern portion
of the Good Magician's castle. The hallway extends to the east and west, and
to the north and south lie unmarked wooden doors.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads north from here.
A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: The southeast corner
rooms.Description:
You are in the southeast corner of Good Magician Humfrey's castle. Wide, clean
hallways run to the north and west from here, and to the south is yet another
wooden door, looking the same as all the others.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads south from here.

rooms.Name: The staircase
rooms.Description:
This large stone staircase leads straight up to the second floor. There are
some funny smells coming from up there, but the Good Magician doesn't seem
to be anywhere on the first floor, so you might as well go on up. To the
north is an intersection between two hallways, if you change your mind.

rooms.Name: Inside a nice little cottage
rooms.Description:
You are in a small cottage way off in the wilderness, this looks to be the
inhabited at the moment.  This is the home of Tandy and Smash, a half
nymph and a half ogre.  They seem very friendly and invite you in, but
becareful, Smash looks like he could be very mean if you try to do anything
violent.  He loves Tandy and would give up his own soul to save her.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
You are in a small chamber that appears to be used for housing "guests" of the
Good Magician, those serving out the required year in exchange for their
Answer. The chamber appears fairly comfortable, with a nice bed, desk, chair,
and a small but adequate chest of drawers furnishing it. A door to the south
leads back into the hallway.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads out of the chamber.

rooms.Name: A storage room
rooms.Description:
This room is rather stark and bare of furnishings. It seems to be a storage
room, for boxes, crates, bags, barrels, and other containers litter the
floor. A caretaker is walking around here, absently rearranging things into
more neatly ordered piles, and grumbling about how disorganized his master
is. Apparently even powerful Magicians have some faults.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: A storage room
rooms.Description:
This room looks like it is being used to store coils of rope. You see a small
elf running rope through his hands in an exasperated fashion, trying to make
it back into nice neat coils. Someone has apparently been rummaging through
here at random and messing everything up.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
This chamber looks like it is used to house the Good Magician's "guests",
those serving out the required year in order to obtain their Answer. It is
apparently set up to accomodate a variety of different races, for there is
a large tree growing right in the center of it, with a small pool close by.
It is very big and spacious, and there is little by way of furnishings.
Apparently some of the Magician's petitioners are not humanoids.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads out of the chamber.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
This looks like another guest chamber, though it looks more like a cave than
a chamber. It is dark and gloomy, but warm and dry. There isn't much by the
way of furniture, but some authentic human skulls give the place ambience.
You feel a chill in your blood as you look around. Wonder if Humfrey has
rules against molestation of Questioners?

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads out of the chamber.

rooms.Name: A small library
rooms.Description:
To call this room a library is to use the term rather loosely. What is really
looks like is what happens to a library after an explosion. A number of elves
are crawling around on the heaped masses of reading material, trying to get
it into some semblance of order, but the task looks hopeless from what you
can see. You feel kinda sorry for the little guys, but they are probably
working off their year of service, and so have been well-paid for their
efforts. There are doors to the north and west to take you out of here.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.
A wooden door leads out of the "library".

rooms.Name: A storage room
rooms.Description:
This room is simply FULL of little vials of every shape and size. Lots of 
them are scattered across the floor with their caps off, so those are most
likely safe to pick up, but there are a bunch tossed randomly all over every
flat surface in the room, tightly corked, and you shy away from those. You
never can tell what will come out of one of the Good Magician's vials...

Exits.Description: A wooden door takes you back into the hallway.
A wooden door takes you out of the storage room.

rooms.Name: The distillation room
rooms.Description:
This room looks quite a bit more organized than the others in the central
part of the castle. In fact, it fairly gleams with shining metal. A large,
beautifully polished and maintained distillation device sits on a low stone
table in the middle of the room. A number of texts are neatly piled near the
device, and sheafs of notes are stuck haphazardly into the texts. A few vials
of chemicals are neatly stored and labeled on shelves at about chest height.
Humfrey may be disorganized, but he is not a fool, you decide. You may exit
this room to the north or west.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads out of the distillation room.
A wooden door leads back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: The summoning room
rooms.Description:
As soon as you enter this room, you screech to a halt. There's a big huge
pentagram right in the middle of the floor! A couple of braziers are pouring
out acrid-smelling smoke, and magical sigils have been drawn all over the
floor. Looks like some demonology goes on in here, and you probably don't
want to stick around too long...

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.
A wooden door leads out of the summoning room.

rooms.Name: Another storage room
rooms.Description:
This room looks like it is used for "general storage" (i.e. "junk"). Lots of
boxes, barrels, scroll cases, small statues, rodents, bones, bottles, bags,
soap, ropes, and antelopes are here, and that only begins the list. A few of
the Magician's servants are trying to sort all of this stuff, but the more
they get classified, the more junk seems to be around. Poor guys. You can
leave this room to the south or the west.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.
A wooden door leads out of the storage room.

rooms.Name: The vivarium
rooms.Description:
There is definitely some heavy magic involved in this place, for as you open
the door here, you find yourself in a garden filling many times the space
that the room within could conceivably have held. A large variety of Xanth's
flowering pants are here, including yellow buttercups (which are turning 
slightly brown and rancid because of the hot sun), blue and green irises
that blink their large eyes at you, and even a patch of skunk cabbages,
with their broad white stripe and their putrid smell. Each of these is
thoughtfully labeled with a small placard near its respective plant. This
looks like a nice place to relax for awhile. There are doors to the south
and east when (and if) you decide to leave.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads out into the hallway.
A wooden door leads out of the vivarium here.

rooms.Name: The copy room
rooms.Description:
Every good magician needs a way to copy his material, and this Good Magician
is no exception. However, instead of the room full of scribes you expected,
there is only a small cat sitting on a large wooden table. Fascinated, you
watch as a bunch of elves lift up the disinterested beast, plant a scroll
under its behind, and wait. After a moment, the cat begins purring, and a
long white piece of paper comes out of its mouth. Must be a copy-cat...

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads south into the hallway.
A wooden door leads out of the copy room.

rooms.Name: Humfrey's Private Menagerie
rooms.Description:
This room looks like it's much bigger than it should be. Inside you see a
number of cages with some of Xanth's most prominent animal species. The
animals look comfortable enough, and well-exercised. Apparently Humfrey
is interested in biology as well as everything else. You decide to stay
away from the cages...some of these beasts look dangerous! There are
doors to the south and east, when you decide to leave.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads out of the Menagerie.
A wooden door leads out into the hallway.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
This room is obviosuly used to house the Magician's "guests", those that are
fulfilling their obligatory year of service in exchange for their Answer. It
looks as if the Magician is a kindly master, for the room is clean and well-
ordered, and looks like a simple but comfortable place to sleep. You notice
a cozy bed, chair, desk, and chest of drawers furnishing the place. A door
to the north takes you back into the hallway.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
This looks like another of those guest chambers. It looks basically the same
as all the others, comfortable, functional, and realtively bare of decor.
With all the people who come to the Magician for Answers, it's probably hard
to please everybody, anyway. There is a door to the north.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
The word "chamber" is used rather loosely here. The door opens into a foul-
smelling swamp, and a rather large one at that. Bunches of peat moss and some
lilypads dot the blackish water, and the smell of wet mud is powerfully in
evidence. Apparently not all of the Magician's supplicants have the same
taste in domiciles. There is a door to the north.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
Woah!! This door opens into a big cave, right at the edge of a humungous
cliff! It must be six or seven hundred feet down! You see a nest piled up in
the rear of the cave, but no eggs. This place is getting stranger and
stranger! The door to the north takes you back to the hallway.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back to the hallway.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
This looks like just another guest chamber the same as all the...well, the
same as ALMOST all the others. Bed, chair, desk, chest of drawers. Yawn.
Door to the north, too.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.

rooms.Name: A guest chamber
rooms.Description:
This looks like yet another guest chamber, with the same setup as all of the
other guest chambers (those constructed for humanoids, anyway) in the castle.
A cozy bed, comfortable chair, wide desk, and small chest of drawers serve
as furnishings to the otherwise spartan room. It looks comfortable enough,
but not particularly homey. A door to the north leads back into the hallway.

Exits.Description: A wooden door leads back into the hallway.
